data.title: The Judd School
data.text:
Jeremy Cronk is a Foundation Governor (and SEND link governor) who grew up and attended school in Tonbridge. He read History at the University of Edinburgh, and spent an exchange year at McGill University, Montreal. After university and law school, he worked as a solicitor in London and Tokyo, before joining SSE, the energy company. Jeremy now lives back in Tonbridge with his wife, Louise, and two young children. He enjoys swimming, dog walks with the family, and stand-up comedy.

Governor Meeting attendance 2022/23 - 6/6

Declared Business & Financial Interests - None

Term - 1/9/20-31/8/24

Bill Webb was at school in Tonbridge, is a Skinner and Economics Scholar of Trinity Hall, Cambridge. Following a career in management and consulting in the fashion and retail industries he currently works part time in The University of the Arts Business School, teaching and supervising both undergraduate and postgraduate students. He lives in South West London with his Chinese wife Ying, their son Robert and dog Crumble. He enjoys current affairs, flyfishing, antiques and travel. He is Manager of his son's Colts team at Wimbledon Rugby Football Club.

Governor Meeting attendance 2022/23 - 5/6

Declared Business & Financial Interests - None

Term - 1/9/21-31/8/25

Phil Greatrex is a former pupil of Judd (1967-74). He was a player for, and treasurer of, the Old Juddian rugby club for over 10 years and more recently treasurer of the Old Juddian Society for 25 years, where he is still a main committee member. Phil, a chartered accountant by training, is senior partner at CW Energy LLP where he has worked for over 25 years providing taxation services predominantly to the oil and gas sector in the UK.

Phil has lived with his family in the Tunbridge Wells area since finishing his degree and has always maintained a strong interest in, and links with the school, culminating with his recent appointment as an associate Governor of the school.

Governor Meeting attendance 2022/23 - 6/6

Declared Business & Financial Interests - Director and shareholder of PPJ Oiltax Consultants Ltd and a partner in CW Energy LLP

Term - 1/9/23-31/8/27

Ben Thompson

I have lived in and around Tunbridge Wells most of my life. I have five sons. The younger three being Judd boys - Zachary (left in 2020, now at Exeter), Samuel (left in 2022, now at New College Oxford) and Daniel (Year 12). For myself, I attended Canford School and graduated in Music from Durham University. My wife Rachel teaches at St Ronan’s School in Hawkhurst, as assistant deputy head of pastoral care.

I have more than thirty years’ experience in marketing and communications, working in the UK and the USA and specialising in the financial and professional services sectors most recently working with companies in renewable energy and natural capital, which are making a positive environmental impact.

Since 2015, I have been a member of the school’s Development Fundraising Committee and am heartened by the amount of support and parental engagement fostered by the school. I have encouraged my boys to make the most of the outstanding opportunities and facilities offered by Judd.

In my spare time I play squash, tennis, golf, the piano and am a keen sailor.

Governor Meeting attendance 2022/23 - 4/6

Declared Business & Financial Interests - None

Term - 1/9/21 to 31/9/25

Donna Western

Donna has enjoyed a wide-ranging career spanning finance, start-up, technology and biotech across the US and UK and is currently at the Bank of England. Fast-paced technology-led environments have intensified her interest in how schools prepare students to thrive in an ever-changing world moving at unprecedented pace. Donna is a local Sea Scout leader and lives in Tonbridge with her husband, Mark, and two sons. She has been involved with the Judd School since 2019 and looks forward to continuing an active role in the school’s life.

Governor Meeting attendance 2022/23 - 6/6

Declared Business & Financial Interests - None

Term - 9/7/21-8/7/2025
